name: Ayo
overview: Ayo is a computer game version of the traditional African board game Mancala. You may play with a friend or against the computer. The game is played on a long wooden board into which two rows of six hollows, known as houses, are carved. The object is to eat as many of your opponent's seeds as you can, while preventing your opponent from eating your's. Ayo was released on the cassette bundled with the Micro User magazine, volume 4, issue 11, in January 1987.
